plot: Best-Response Bayesian Reinforcement Learning with Bayes-adaptive POMDPs for Centaurs
summary:
Centaurs are half-human, half-AI decision-makers where the AI's goal is to complement the human. To do so, the AI must be able to recognize the goals and constraints of the human and have the means to help them. They present a novel formulation of the interaction between the AI and the human as a sequential game where agents are modelled using Bayesian best-response models.
 They identify novel trade-off for centaurs in partially observable tasks: for the AI's actions to be acceptable to the human, the machine must make sure their beliefs are sufficiently aligned, but aligning beliefs might be costly. They present a preliminary theoretical analysis of this trade-offs and its dependence on task structure.
